confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at 2:50â€¯PM local time on 26â€¯Novemberâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
At least 13 people, including one firefighter, died and about 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,000 units with approximately 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed in flames.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fire spread.
Firefighters rated the incident as a 5â€‘level fire (highest severity) and are continuing suppression efforts.
